content:
Hey Everybody - what do you think of moving the github notifications to a dedicated zulip stream? (maybe cds-hooks-github)? You'd have to subscribe to an additional stream (if you want to get pushes for github issues/comments), but on the flip side, it would be easier to see the actual cds-hooks conversations.

Is this something that we should do? thoughts?

Isaac
to creating a new cds-hooks-github stream and pushing the Github notifications there
@Josh Mandel or others - any objections to directing Github notifications to a new cds-hooks-github stream?
No objections â€” it's a great idea!

Ok, done. I created the new cds-hooks-github stream and auto-subscribed everyone subscribed to cds-hooks to this new stream. That ensures everyone who was receiving these notifications still gets them and if you now want to mute the Github notifications can you by simply muting / adjusting your notification preferences for the new stream.
@Kevin Shekleton Do you expect the comments posted on github or to the cds-hooks-github track here?
@Sunanda Veeraganti - All new Github issues and comments on issues now get posted to the cds-hooks-github stream
